text: In which hotel are you staying?
How long have you been here for?
translate: Hoe lank is u al hier?

text: How long will you be staying?

translate: Besoek my asseblief! / Kom kuier vir my!

text: Shall we see each other tomorrow?
I am sorry, but I already have plans.
translate: Ek is jammer, maar ek het reeds planne.
Die familie is nie klein nie.

text: Peter and Martha are from Berlin.
translate: Peter en Martha kom van Berlyn (af).

text: Do both of you speak German?
Madrid and Berlin are also capital cities.
translate: Madrid en Berlyn is ook hoofstede.

text: Capital cities are big and noisy.
We only work for five days.
Do you drink tea with lemon?
Do you drink coffee with sugar?
Do you drink water with ice?
People are drinking wine and beer.
translate: Die mense drink wyn en bier.

text: Do you drink Coke with rum?

translate: Ek hou nie van sjampanje nie.
Ek hou nie van wyn nie.
Ek hou nie van bier nie.

text: The child likes cocoa and apple juice.
translate: Die kind hou van sjokolademelk en appelsap.

text: The woman likes orange and grapefruit juice.
translate: Die vrou hou van lemoensap en pomelosap.

text: Where do they like to go?
What colour / color (am.) is the snow? White.
translate: Watter kleur is die sneeu? Wit.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the sun? Yellow.
translate: Watter kleur is die son? Geel.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the orange? Orange.
translate: Watter kleur is die lemoen? Oranje.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the cherry? Red.
translate: Watter kleur is die kersie? Rooi.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the sky? Blue.
translate: Watter kleur is die hemel? Blou.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the grass? Green.
translate: Watter kleur is die gras? Groen.

text: They like to listen to music.
Where do they not like to go?
translate: Waarheen gaan hulle nie graag nie?

text: They do not like to dance.
What colour / color (am.) is the earth? Brown.
translate: Watter kleur is die aarde? Bruin.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the cloud? Grey / Gray (am.).
translate: Watter kleur is die wolke? Grys.

text: What colour / color (am.) are the tyres / tires (am.)? Black.
translate: Watter kleur is die bande? Swart.

text: He is here and she is here.
translate: Hy is hier en sy is hier.

text: There is a garden behind the house.
There is no street in front of the house.
translate: Voor die huis is daar nie ’n straat nie.

text: There are trees next to the house.
translate: Langs die huis is daar bome.

text: The kitchen and bathroom are here.
translate: Hier is die kombuis en die badkamer.

text: The living room and bedroom are there.
translate: Daar is die woonkamer en die slaapkamer.

text: We are going to the living room.
There is a sofa and an armchair there.
The TV set is brand new.
What would you like to drink?
Do you play a musical instrument?
We are having class / a lesson.
I am currently reading this book.
translate: Ek lees op die oomblik hierdie boek.

text: What do you like to read?
Do you like to go to concerts?
translate: Gaan u graag na konserte toe?

text: Do you like to go to the theatre / theater (am.)?
Do you like to go to the opera?

translate: Om tale te leer is interessant.

text: We want to speak with people.

translate: Een dag het vier en twintig ure.

text: I was at the cinema yesterday.
translate: Gister was ek in die bioskoop.
Ek bly tuis. / Ek bly by die huis.
Mag ek u voorstel aan Meneer Müller?

text: Are you here for the first time?
translate: Is dit u eerste keer hier?

text: No, I was here once last year.
translate: Nee, ek was laas jaar ook hier.

text: How do you like it here?
A lot. The people are nice.
translate: Baie goed. Die mense is gaaf.

text: And I like the scenery, too.
translate: En ek hou ook van die landskap.

text: No, my wife / my husband is also here.
translate: Nee, my vrou / my man is ook hier.

text: And those are my two children.
translate: En daar is my twee kinders.

text: I would like to go to the station.
translate: Ek wil na die stasie toe gaan.

text: I would like to go to the airport.
translate: Ek wil na die lughawe toe gaan.

text: I would like to go to the city centre / center (am.).
translate: Ek wil na die middestad toe gaan.

text: How do I get to the station?
translate: Hoe kom ek by die stasie?

text: How do I get to the airport?
translate: Hoe kom ek by die lughawe?

text: How do I get to the city centre / center (am.)?
translate: Hoe kom ek by die middestad?

text: I would like to rent a car.
What is there to see in the city?
translate: Wat is daar te sien in die stad?

text: Go on a harbour / harbor (am.) tour.
Are there any other places of interest?
translate: Watter ander besienswaardighede is daar nog?

text: We are cleaning the apartment today.
My husband is washing the car.
The children are cleaning the bicycles.
translate: Die kinders maak die fietse skoon.

text: The children are cleaning up the children’s room.
translate: Die kinders maak die kinderkamer skoon.

text: My husband is tidying up his desk.
translate: My man ruim sy lessenaar op.

text: I am putting the laundry in the washing machine.
translate: Ek sit die wasgoed in die wasmasjien.

text: I am hanging up the laundry.
I waited for you for half an hour.
translate: Ek het ’n halfuur (lank) vir jou gewag.

text: Don’t you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
translate: Het jy nie ’n selfoon by jou nie?

text: Take an umbrella with you next time!
I have the day off tomorrow.
I’m sorry, I can’t make it tomorrow.
translate: Ek is jammer, môre pas my nie.

text: Do you already have plans for this weekend?
translate: Het jy planne vir die naweek?

text: Or do you already have an appointment?
I suggest that we meet on the weekend.
translate: Ek stel voor ons ontmoet mekaar die naweek.

text: Shall we go to the beach?
Shall we go to the mountains?
translate: Sal ons na die berge toe gaan?

text: I will pick you up at the office.
translate: Ek kom haal jou by die kantoor.

text: I will pick you up at home.
translate: Ek kom haal jou by die huis.

text: I will pick you up at the bus stop.
translate: Ek kom haal jou by die bushalte.
In die somer skyn die son.

text: We like to go for a walk in summer.
translate: In die somer gaan stap ons graag.

text: It snows or rains in winter.
translate: In die winter sneeu of reën dit.

text: We like to stay home in winter.
translate: In die winter bly ons graag tuis.

text: What is the weather like today?

translate: Daar is geen warm water nie.

text: There is no telephone in the room.
translate: Daar is nie ’n telefoon in die kamer nie.

text: There is no TV in the room.
translate: Daar is nie ’n televisie in die kamer nie.
Die kamer het nie ’n balkon nie.

text: Is there a youth hostel nearby?
translate: Is daar ’n jeugherberg in die nabyheid?

text: Is there a boarding house / a bed and breakfast nearby?
translate: Is daar ’n gastehuis in die nabyheid?
Is daar ’n restaurant in die nabyheid?
Maar ek rook nie meer nie.

text: Does it disturb you if I smoke?
translate: Pla dit u as ek rook?
Maar nou is ons hier met vakansie.
Ja, vandag is dit beslis warm.

text: I have a kiwi and a melon.
I have an orange and a grapefruit.
I have an apple and a mango.
translate: Ek het ’n appel en ’n veselperske / mango.

text: I have a banana and a pineapple.
I am making a fruit salad.
I am eating toast with butter.
I am eating toast with butter and jam.
translate: Ek eet roosterbrood met botter en konfyt.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine.
I am eating a sandwich with margarine and tomatoes.
translate: Ek eet ’n toebroodjie met margarien en tamatie.
Ons het brood en rys nodig.
Ons het vis en biefstuk / steak nodig.
Ons het pizza en spaghetti nodig.

text: Do you have a vacant room?
We need carrots and tomatoes for the soup.
translate: Ons het wortels en tamaties vir die sop nodig.

text: What does the room cost per night?
translate: Hoeveel kos die kamer per nag?

text: I would like a room with a bathroom.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n kamer met ’n bad hê.

text: I would like a room with a shower.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n kamer met ’n stort hê.

text: Is there a fax machine here?
What time do you serve breakfast?
What time do you serve lunch?
What time do you serve dinner?
Do you have a new kitchen?
What do you want to cook today?
Do you cook on an electric or a gas stove?
translate: Kook jy op ’n elektriese of gasstoof?

text: Do you have a tin opener / can opener (am.)?
Do you have a bottle opener?
Are you cooking the soup in this pot?
translate: Kook jy die sop in hierdie pot?

text: Are you frying the fish in this pan?
translate: Braai jy die vis in hierdie pan?

text: Are you grilling the vegetables on this grill?
translate: Rooster jy die groente op hierdie / dié rooster?

text: Here are the knives, the forks and the spoons.
translate: Hier is die messe, vurke en lepels.

text: Here are the glasses, the plates and the napkins.
translate: Hier is die glase, die borde en die servette.

text: When is the next train to Berlin?
translate: Wanneer is die volgende trein na Berlyn?

text: When is the next train to Paris?
translate: Wanneer is die volgende trein na Parys?

text: When is the next train to London?
translate: Wanneer is die volgende trein na Londen?

text: When does the train for Warsaw leave?
translate: Hoe laat vertrek die trein na Warskou?

text: When does the train for Stockholm leave?
translate: Hoe laat vertrek die trein na Stockholm?

text: When does the train for Budapest leave?
translate: Hoe laat vertrek die trein na Boedapest?

text: I’d like a ticket to Madrid.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n kaartjie na Madrid hê.

text: I’d like a ticket to Prague.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n kaartjie na Praag hê.

text: I’d like a ticket to Bern.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n kaartjie na Bern hê.

text: When does the train arrive in Vienna?
translate: Wanneer kom die trein in Wene aan?

text: When does the train arrive in Moscow?
translate: Wanneer kom die trein in Moskou aan?

text: When does the train arrive in Amsterdam?
translate: Wanneer kom die trein in Amsterdam aan?

text: Do I have to change trains?
From which platform does the train leave?
translate: Vanaf watter perron vertrek die trein?

text: I’d like a one-way ticket to Brussels.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n eenrigtingkaartjie na Brussel hê.

text: I’d like a return ticket to Copenhagen.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n retoerkaartjie na Kopenhagen hê.

text: What does a berth in the sleeper cost?
translate: Hoeveel kos ’n plek in die slaapwa?

text: I would like the menu, please.
translate: Ek wil graag die spyskaart hê asseblief.

text: I’d like a coffee with milk.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n koffie met melk hê.

text: I’d like a tea with lemon.
translate: Ek wil graag tee met suurlemoen hê.

text: I’d like a tea with milk.
translate: Ek wil graag tee met melk hê.

text: I’d like to book a flight to Athens.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n vlug na Athene bespreek.

text: I would like to confirm my reservation.
translate: Ek wil graag my bespreking bevestig.

text: I would like to cancel my reservation.
translate: Ek wil graag my bespreking kanselleer.

text: I would like to change my reservation.
translate: Ek wil graag my bespreking verander.

text: When is the next flight to Rome?
translate: Wanneer is die volgende vlug na Rome?
Is daar nog twee sitplekke beskikbaar?

text: No, we have only one seat available.
translate: Nee, ons het nog net een sitplek beskikbaar.

text: When does a bus go to the city centre / center (am.)?
translate: Wanneer is daar ’n bus na die middestad?

text: How much luggage can I take?
Yes, and I also speak some Italian.
translate: Ja, en ek kan ook ’n bietjie Italiaans praat.

text: I think you speak very well.
translate: Ek dink u praat baie mooi (Spaans/Italiaans/...).

text: But speaking and writing is difficult.
translate: Maar praat en skryf is moeilik.
Ek maak nog steeds baie foute.

text: You only have a slight accent.
One can tell where you come from.
translate: Mens kan hoor waar u vandaan kom.

text: What is your mother tongue / native language (am.)?
Are you taking a language course?
I don’t remember the name right now.
translate: Ek kan nie op die oomlik die naam onthou nie.

text: The title is not coming to me.
I’d like chips / French fries (am.) with ketchup.
Do you also like to eat leek?
Do you also like to eat sauerkraut?
Do you also like to eat lentils?
Do you also like to eat carrots?
Do you also like to eat broccoli?
Do you also like to eat peppers?

translate: Ek hou nie van uie nie.
Ek hou nie van olywe nie.
Ek hou nie van sampioene nie.

text: Is it dangerous to hitchhike alone?
translate: Is dit gevaarlik om alleen te ryloop?

text: Is it dangerous to go for a walk at night?
translate: Is dit gevaarlik om te gaan stap in die aand?
Ons is op die verkeerde pad.

text: Is there a parking lot here?
How long can one park here?
translate: Hoe lank kan mens hier parkeer?

text: Do you take the ski lift to the top?
translate: Gaan u met die skihyser na bo?

text: I would like an ice cream with whipped cream.
translate: Ek wil graag roomys met room hê.

text: I would like some fruit or cheese.
translate: Ek wil graag vrugte of kaas hê.

text: We would like to have breakfast.
We would like to have lunch.
We would like to have dinner.
What would you like for breakfast?
translate: Wat wil u vir ontbyt hê?

text: Some salt and pepper also, please.
Where is the tourist information office?
Do you have a city map for me?
Can one reserve a room here?
I would like a guide who speaks German.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n gids hê wat Duits kan praat.

text: I would like a guide who speaks Italian.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n gids hê wat Italiaans kan praat.

text: I would like a guide who speaks French.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n gids hê wat Frans kan praat.

text: Which bus goes to the city centre / center (am.)?
translate: Watter bus gaan na die middestad?

text: Which bus do I have to take?
Where do I have to change?
How much does a ticket cost?
How many stops are there before downtown / the city centre?
translate: Hoeveel haltes is daar voor die middestad?

text: You have to get off here.
You have to get off at the back.
The next train is in 5 minutes.
translate: Die volgende trein kom oor 5 minute.

text: The next tram is in 10 minutes.
translate: Die volgende trem kom oor 10 minute.

text: The next bus is in 15 minutes.
translate: Die volgende bus kom oor 15 minute.

text: A ticket? – No, I don’t have one.
translate: ’n Kaartjie? – Nee, ek het nie ’n kaartjie nie.

text: Then you have to pay a fine.
Is that the train to Berlin?
translate: Is dit die trein na Berlyn?

text: When does the train arrive in Berlin?
translate: Wanneer kom die trein in Berlyn aan?
Verskoon my, mag ek verby kom?

text: I think this is my seat.
translate: Ek dink dit is my sitplek.

text: I think you’re sitting in my seat.
translate: Ek dink dat u in my sitplek sit.

text: The sleeper is at the end of the train.
translate: Die slaapwa is aan die einde van die trein.

text: And where is the dining car? – At the front.
translate: En waar is die eetwa? – Aan die voorkant van die trein.

text: Can I sleep in the middle?
translate: Mag ek in die middel slaap?

text: Can I sleep at the top?
When will we get to the border?
translate: Wanneer kom ons by die grens aan?

text: How long does the journey to Berlin take?
translate: Hoe lank duur die rit na Berlyn?

text: Do you have something to read?
translate: Het u iets om te lees?

text: Can one get something to eat and to drink here?
translate: Kan mens hier iets te ete en te drinke kry?

text: Could you please wake me up at 7 o’clock?
translate: Kan u my asseblief seweuur wakker maak?

text: Is the market open on Sundays?
Is the fair open on Mondays?
Is the exhibition open on Tuesdays?
Is the zoo open on Wednesdays?
Is the museum open on Thursdays?
Is the gallery open on Fridays?
Does one have to pay an entrance fee?
How much is the entrance fee?
Is there a discount for groups?
Is there a discount for children?
Is there a discount for students?
I’d like a glass of red wine.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n glas rooiwyn hê.

text: I’d like a glass of white wine.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n glas witwyn hê.

text: I’d like a bottle of champagne.
translate: Ek wil graag ’n bottel sjampanje hê.
Ek wil graag iets sonder vleis hê.

text: I’d like something that won’t take much time.
translate: Ek wil graag iets hê wat nie lank gaan vat nie.

text: Would you like that with rice?
Would you like that with pasta?
Would you like that with potatoes?

translate: Ek het dit nie bestel nie.

text: Is there a good restaurant around here?
translate: Waar is daar ’n goeie restaurant hier?

text: Take a left at the corner.
translate: U gaan links om die hoek.

text: Then go straight for a while.
translate: Dan hou u reguit vir ’n rukkie.

text: Then go right for a hundred metres / meters (am.).
translate: Dan hou u regs vir ’n honderd meter.

text: You can also take the bus.
translate: U kan ook die bus neem.

text: You can also take the tram.
translate: U kan ook die trem neem.

text: You can also follow me with your car.
translate: U kan ook maar eenvoudig agter my aan ry.

text: How do I get to the football / soccer (am.) stadium?
translate: Hoe kom ek by die sokkerstadium?

text: Drive until you reach the third traffic light.
translate: Ry tot by die derde verkeerslig.

text: Then turn into the first street on your right.
translate: Draai by die eerste straat regs.

text: Then drive straight through the next intersection.
translate: Hou reguit tot by die volgende kruising.

text: Excuse me, how do I get to the airport?
translate: Verskoon my, hoe kom ek by die lughawe?

text: It is best if you take the underground / subway (am.).
translate: Dit is beter om met die trein te gaan.

text: Simply get out at the last stop.
translate: U ry eenvoudig tot die laaste stasie.

text: Where is the next gas station?
I have a flat tyre / tire (am.).
Can you change the tyre / tire (am.)?
I need a few litres / liters (am.) of diesel.
translate: Ek het ’n paar liter diesel nodig.

text: I have no more petrol / gas (am.).
translate: Ek het nie meer brandstof nie.

text: Do you have a petrol can / jerry can / gas can (am.)?
Where can I make a call?

translate: Ek is op soek na ’n werkswinkel.

text: Do you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
What’s playing at the theatre / theater (am.) this evening?
translate: Wat speel vanaand in die teater?

text: What’s playing at the cinema / movies (am.) this evening?
translate: Wat draai vanaand in die bioskoop?

text: Are tickets for the theatre / theater (am.) still available?
translate: Is daar nog kaartjies beskikbaar vir die teater?

text: Are tickets for the cinema / movies (am.) still available?
translate: Is daar nog kaartjies beskikbaar vir die bioskoop?

text: Are tickets for the football / soccer am. game still available?
translate: Is daar nog kaartjies beskikbaar vir die sokker?

text: I want to sit in the back.
translate: Ek wil graag heel agter sit.

text: I want to sit somewhere in the middle.
translate: Ek wil graag iewers in die middel sit.

text: I want to sit at the front.
translate: Ek wil graag heel voor sit.

text: Can you get me a ticket?
translate: Kan u vir my ’n kaartjie kry?

text: Is there a golf course nearby?
translate: Is daar ’n gholfbaan in die nabyheid?

text: Is there a tennis court nearby?
translate: Is daar ’n tennisbaan in die nabyheid?

text: Is there an indoor swimming pool nearby?
translate: Is daar ’n binnenshuise swembad in die nabyheid?

text: Isn’t it dangerous to swim there?
translate: Is dit nie gevaarlik om daar te swem nie?

text: Can one rent a sun umbrella / parasol here?
Can one rent a deck chair here?
Can one rent a boat here?
I would like to water ski.

translate: Het jy dan ski’s by jou?
Het jy dan skistewels by jou?

text: Do you see the tower there?
translate: Sien jy die toring daar anderkant?

text: Do you see the mountain there?
translate: Sien jy die berg daar anderkant?

text: Do you see the village there?
translate: Sien jy die dorp daar anderkant?

text: Do you see the river there?
translate: Sien jy die rivier daar anderkant?

text: Do you see the bridge there?
translate: Sien jy die brug daar anderkant?

text: Do you see the lake there?
translate: Sien jy die meer daar anderkant?

text: We want to go to the cinema.
A good film is playing today.
How much are the admission tickets?
I want to sit at the back.
I want to sit at the front.
I want to sit in the middle.
translate: Ek wil graag in die middel sit.
Die rolprent was nie vervelig nie.

text: But the book on which the film was based was better.
translate: Maar die boek waarop die rolprent gebasseer was, is beter.

text: You have to pack our suitcase!
Don’t forget your traveller’s cheques / traveler’s checks (am.)!
Take some suntan lotion with you.
Take the sun hat with you.
Do you want to take a road map?
Do you want to take a travel guide?
Do you want to take an umbrella?
How do you like the music?
translate: Wat dink u van die musiek?

text: Remember to take pants, shirts and socks.
translate: Hou die broeke, die hemde en die sokkies in gedagte.

text: Remember to take ties, belts and sports jackets.
translate: Hou die dasse, die gordels en die sportbaadjies in gedagte.

text: Remember to take pyjamas, nightgowns and t-shirts.
translate: Hou die slaapklere, die naghemde en die T-hemde in gedagte.

text: You need shoes, sandals and boots.
translate: Jy het skoene, sandale en stewels nodig.

text: You need handkerchiefs, soap and a nail clipper.
translate: Jy het sakdoeke, seep en ’n naelskêr nodig.

text: You need a comb, a toothbrush and toothpaste.
translate: Jy het ’n kam, tandeborsel en tandepasta nodig.

text: But the band plays very well.
translate: Maar die groep speel heel goed.

text: No, this is the first time.
translate: Nee, dit is die eerste keer.
Ek was nog nooit tevore hier nie.
Ek kan nie so goed dans nie.

text: Shall we go to the department store?
translate: Gaan ons na die afdelingswinkel toe?

text: I want to do a lot of shopping.

translate: Ek het koeverte en briefpapier nodig.
Ek het balpuntpenne en koki penne nodig.

text: I need a cupboard and a chest of drawers.
translate: Ek het ’n kas en ’n laaikas nodig.

text: I need a desk and a bookshelf.
translate: Ek het ’n lessenaar en ’n boekrak nodig.

text: I need a doll and a teddy bear.
translate: Ek het ’n pop en teddiebeer nodig.

text: I need a football and a chess board.
translate: Ek het ’n sokkerbal en ’n skaakstel nodig.

text: I need a hammer and a pair of pliers.
translate: Ek het ’n hammer en ’n tang nodig.

text: I need a drill and a screwdriver.
translate: Ek het ’n boor en ’n skroewedraaier nodig.

text: Where is the jewellery / jewelry (am.) department?
I need a chain and a bracelet.
translate: Ek het ’n halssnoer en ’n armband nodig.

text: I need a ring and earrings.
translate: Ek het ’n ring en oorbelle nodig.

text: What does it cost to go to the station?
translate: Hoeveel kos dit na die stasie?

text: What does it cost to go to the airport?
translate: Hoeveel kos dit na die lughawe?

text: Please turn left at the corner.
translate: Draai asseblief links by die hoek.

text: That is okay, please keep the change.
translate: Dis in die haak, hou asseblief die kleingeld.
Kan u my na hierdie adres neem?
Kan u my na my hotel neem?
Kan u my na die strand neem?

text: I also have a video camera.
Where can I find a battery?
There is a café over there.
There is a restaurant over there.
Where are the gorillas and the zebras?
translate: Waar is die gorillas en die sebras?

text: Where are the tigers and the crocodiles?
translate: Waar is die tiere en die krokodille?
Ja, ek moet bietjie oefening kry.

text: I am a member of a sports club.
There is a football / soccer (am.) stadium in our city.
translate: Daar is ’n sokkerstadium in ons stad.

text: There is also a swimming pool with a sauna.
And there is a golf course.
There is a football / soccer (am.) match on now.
translate: Daar is ’n sokkerwedstryd aan die gang.

text: The German team is playing against the English one.
translate: Die Duitse span speel teen die Engelse.
Op die oomblik speel hulle gelyk op.

text: I want to buy a present.
A large one or a small one?
May I see this one, please?
translate: Mag ek die een sien asseblief?

text: Or is it made of plastic?
And the bag is really very reasonable.
translate: En die handsak is werklik billik.

text: Can I exchange it if needed?
translate: Kan ek dit omruil indien nodig?
Ons sal dit as ’n geskenk toedraai.

text: Shall we go to the swimming pool?

translate: Het jy lus om te gaan swem?

text: Do you have a bathing suit?
Can you jump in the water?

text: I am getting out of the water now.

text: What do you do for a living?
I work as a nurse part-time.
We will soon receive our pension.

text: What would you like to become some day?

text: I would like to become an engineer.
I want to go to college.
I am doing an internship abroad.

text: We always go to the cafeteria at noon.

text: I am looking for a job.

text: I have already been unemployed for a year.

We’re looking for a butcher shop.

text: I’m looking for a jeweller / jeweler (am.).
I’m looking for a photo equipment store.

text: I actually plan to buy a roll of film.

text: I actually plan to buy a cake.

text: I’m looking for a confectionery to buy a cake.

text: I want to go to the bakery.

For a card and a letter.

text: Which credit cards can one use?

translate: Ek verstaan nie die woord nie.
Ek verstaan nie die sin nie.

text: The man is wearing a hat.

translate: Mens sien nie die hare nie.

text: One cannot see the ears either.
translate: Mens sien ook nie die ore nie.

text: One cannot see his back either.

text: I am drawing the eyes and the mouth.
translate: Ek teken die oë en die mond.

text: The man is dancing and laughing.
The man has a long nose.

text: He is also wearing a scarf around his neck.

text: It is winter and it is cold.

text: The man is made of snow.
translate: Die man is van sneeu gemaak.

text: He is neither wearing pants nor a coat.

text: But the man is not freezing.
Six months make half a year.
Where has he left his glasses?

text: The clock hangs on the wall.

text: The children cannot find their parents.

Do you want to eat here?
Do you want to sleep here?

text: Do you want to go to the cinema?

text: I have the appointment at ten o’clock.
translate: Ek het die afspraak om tien uur.

What insurance company do you belong to?

translate: U bloeddruk is in die haak.

text: I will give you an injection.
I will give you some pills.
I am giving you a prescription for the pharmacy.

Ek vind / kry nie my sleutel nie.
Ek vind / kry nie my kaartjie nie.

Het jy jou kaartjie gevind / gekry?

text: And her credit card is also gone.

translate: Nee, dit kos maar net eenhonderd Euro.
Maar ek sal binnekort klaar wees.

text: Do you want some more soup?

translate: Nee, ek wil nie meer hê nie.

text: But I already know a lot of people.

text: But I will be back on Sunday.
translate: Maar ek kom reeds Sondag terug.
Nee, sy is nog net sewentien.

text: But she already has a boyfriend.
70 years ago he was still young.

A man who weighs fifty kilos is thin.

text: I am not coming because I have no time.

I am wearing a red dress.
I am wearing a green dress.
I am not staying because I still have to work.

Ek gaan omdat ek moeg is.

text: I’m going because it is already late.

A fat lady lives at the top.

text: She took a piece of chocolate.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.

text: He had no money, only debts.

text: He had no luck, only bad luck.

text: He had no success, only failure.

text: He was not friendly, but unfriendly.

My foot and hand also hurt.

text: I have a car / an automobile.

text: I have a knife, a fork and a spoon.

text: Where is the salt and pepper?

text: I didn’t come because I was ill.

text: She didn’t come because she was tired.
translate: Sy het nie gekom nie omdat sy moeg was.
Waarom het hy nie gekom nie?

text: He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
translate: Hy het nie gekom nie want hy was nie geïnteresseerd nie.

text: We didn’t come because our car is damaged.
translate: Ons het nie gekom nie omdat ons motor stukkend is.
Waarom het die mense nie gekom nie?

text: They didn’t come because they missed the train.
translate: Hulle het nie gekom nie omdat hulle die trein verpas het.
Waarom het jy nie gekom nie?

text: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
translate: Ek het nie gekom nie omdat ek nie mag nie.

text: I was talking on the phone all the time.
translate: Ek was die heel tyd op die telefoon.
Ek het die hele storie vertel.
Ek het die hele aand geleer.
Ek het die hele dag gewerk.
Ek het die hele maaltyd opgeëet.

text: The pictures are on the CD.

text: Do you have a match or a lighter?

He is staying in a cheap hotel.

We had to wash the dishes.

Did you have to pay a fine?

text: Who had to take the train?
We did not want to stay long.
translate: Ons wou nie lank bly nie.

text: We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
translate: Ek wou nou nou net ’n oproep maak.

text: I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.

text: I thought you wanted to call your wife.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.
translate: Ek dag / dog / het gedink jy wou die inligtingstoonbank bel.

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.

Ek het die hele teks verstaan.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Ek weet dit – Ek het dit geweet.

text: I write that – I wrote that.
translate: Ek skryf – Ek het dit geskryf.

text: I hear that – I heard that.
translate: Ek hoor dit – Ek het dit gehoor.

text: I’ll get it – I got it.
translate: Ek haal dit – Ek het dit gehaal.

text: I’ll bring that – I brought that.
translate: Ek bring dit – Ek het dit gebring.

text: I’ll buy that – I bought that.
translate: Ek koop dit – Ek het dit gekoop.

text: I expect that – I expected that.
translate: Ek verwag dit – Ek het dit verwag.

text: I’ll explain that – I explained that.
translate: Ek verduidelik dit – Ek het dit verduidelik.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Ek ken dit – Ek het dit geken.

translate: Op watter koerant het jy ingeteken?

text: Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).

text: My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: My vrou wou nie met my skaak speel nie.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.

text: They did not want to tidy the room.

text: They did not want to go to bed.

text: He was not allowed to eat ice cream.

text: He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
translate: Hy mag nie sjokolade geëet het nie.

text: He was not allowed to eat sweets.
translate: Hy mag nie lekkergoed geëet het nie.

text: I was allowed to make a wish.
translate: Ek mag vir iets gewens het.

text: I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
translate: Ek mag vir my ’n rok gekoop het.

text: I was allowed to take a chocolate.
translate: Ek mag vir my ’n sjokolade gevat het.

text: Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
translate: Mag jy in die vliegtuig rook?

text: Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
translate: Mag jy in die hospitaal bier drink?

text: Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?
translate: Mag jy die hond in die hotel saamneem?

text: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
translate: In die vakansie mag die kinders laat uitgebly het.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
translate: Hulle mag lank in die werf gespeel het.

text: They were allowed to stay up late.
translate: Hulle mag laat wakker gebly het.

text: Did you have to call an ambulance?
Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: Het u die adres? Ek het dit netnou nog gehad.

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: Het hy betyds gekom? Hy kon nie betyds kom nie.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: Het hy die weg gevind? Hy kon nie die weg vind nie.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
translate: Het hy jou verstaan? Hy kon my nie verstaan nie.

text: Why could you not come on time?
translate: Waarom kon jy nie betyds kom nie?

text: Why could you not find the way?
translate: Waarom kon jy nie die weg vind nie?

text: Why could you not understand him?
translate: Waarom kon jy hom nie verstaan nie?

text: I could not come on time because there were no buses.
translate: Ek kon nie betyds wees nie, omdat daar nie ’n bus was nie.

text: I could not find the way because I had no city map.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.

I had to buy a city map.

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!

text: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: Jy kom so laat – moet nie so laat kom nie!

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: Jy lag so hard – moet nie so hard lag nie!

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!

text: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!

text: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!

text: You work too much – don’t work so much!
translate: Jy werk te veel – moet nie so baie werk nie!

text: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: Jy ry te vinnig – moet nie so vinnig ry nie!

text: Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
translate: Die weer word môre miskien beter.

text: I hope that it gets better.

translate: Weet jy dit voor jou siel?

text: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.

text: I don’t know if he loves me.
translate: Ek weet nie of hy my lief het nie.

text: I don’t know if he’ll come back.
translate: Ek weet nie of hy terugkom nie.

text: I don’t know if he’ll call me.
translate: Ek weet nie of hy my sal bel nie.

text: I wonder if he thinks about me.
translate: Ek wonder of hy aan my dink.

text: I wonder if he has someone else.
translate: Ek wonder of hy iemand anders het.

Of hy wel iemand anders het?

text: Maybe he tells me the truth?

text: I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
translate: Ek twyfel of hy vir my gaan skryf.

text: I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
translate: Ek twyfel of hy met my gaan trou.
Of hy wel werklik van my hou?
Of hy wel vir my gaan skryf?
Of hy wel met my gaan trou?

text: How did you pass the exam?
translate: Hoe het u die eksamen geslaag?

text: How did you find the way?
translate: Hoe het u die pad gevind?

text: With whom did you make an appointment?
translate: Met wie het u ’n afspraak gemaak?

text: With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
translate: Met wie het u u verjaarsdag gevier?

text: What did you come to know?
The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
translate: Die reis was nou wel mooi, maar te uitputtend.

text: The train was on time, but too full.
translate: Die trein was nou wel betyds, maar te vol.

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
translate: Die hotel was nou wel gesellig, maar te duur.

text: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
translate: Hy neem óf die bus óf die trein.

text: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: Hy kom óf vanaand óf môreoggend vroeg.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: Hy bly óf by ons óf in die hotel.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
translate: Sy praat Spaans sowel as Engels.

text: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
translate: Sy het in Madrid sowel as in Londen gewoon.

text: She knows Spain as well as England.
translate: Sy ken Spanje sowel as Engeland.

text: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
translate: Hy is nie net dom nie, maar ook lui.

text: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
translate: Sy is nie net mooi nie, maar ook intelligent.

text: She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: Sy praat nie net Duits nie, maar ook Frans.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Ek kan nie klavier of kitaar speel nie.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Ek kan nie wals of samba nie.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: Ek hou nie van opera of ballet nie.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Hoe vinniger jy werk, hoe vroeër is jy klaar.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Hoe vroeër jy kom, hoe vroeër kan jy gaan.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: Hoe ouer mens word, hoe traer word mens.
Dit maak my kwaad dat jy snork.

text: I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
translate: Dit maak my kwaad dat jy soveel bier drink.

text: I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: Dit maak my kwaad dat jy so laat kom.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
translate: Ek dink dat hy ’n dokter nodig het.
Ek dink dat hy siek is.

text: I think he is sleeping now.
translate: Ek dink dat hy nou slaap.

text: We hope that he marries our daughter.
translate: Ons hoop dat hy met ons dogter trou.

text: We hope that he has a lot of money.
translate: Ons hoop dat hy baie geld het.

text: We hope that he is a millionaire.
translate: Ons hoop dat hy ’n miljoenêr is.

text: I heard that your wife had an accident.
translate: Ek het gehoor dat jou vrou ’n ongeluk gehad het.

text: I heard that she is in the hospital.
translate: Ek het gehoor dat sy in die hospitaal lê.

text: I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
translate: Ek het gehoor dat jou kar afgeskryf is.
Ek is bly dat u gekom het.

text: I’m happy that you are interested.
translate: Ek is bly dat u belangstel.

text: I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
translate: Ek is bly dat u die huis wil koop.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
translate: Ek is bevrees dat die laaste bus al weg is.

text: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
translate: Ek is bevrees dat ons ’n taxi sal moet neem.

text: I’m afraid I have no more money.
translate: Ek is bevrees dat ek geen geld by my het nie.

text: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
translate: Ek wag tot my hare droog is.

text: I’ll wait until the film is over.
translate: Ek wag tot die rolprent klaar is.

text: I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
translate: Ek wag tot die verkeerslig groen is.

text: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
translate: Ja, nog voor die somervakansie begin.

text: Repair the roof before the winter begins.
translate: Herstel die dak voor die winter begin.

text: Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
translate: Was jou hande voor jy aan tafel sit.

text: Close the window before you go out.
translate: Maak toe die venster voor jy uitgaan.

text: Yes, after the class is over.
translate: Ja, nadat die klas verby is.

text: After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: Nadat hy ’n ongeluk gehad het, kon hy nie meer werk nie.

text: After he had lost his job, he went to America.
translate: Nadat hy sy werk verloor het, is hy na Amerika.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
translate: Nadat hy Amerika toe is, het hy ryk geword.

text: Since when is she no longer working?
translate: Van wanneer af werk sy nie meer nie?

text: Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: Ja, sy werk nie meer sedert sy getroud is nie.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: Sedert sy getroud is, werk sy nie meer nie.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
translate: Sedert hulle mekaar ken, is hulle gelukkig.

text: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Sedert hulle kinders het, gaan hulle selde uit.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
translate: Sy kyk televisie terwyl sy stryk.

text: She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Sy luister na musiek terwyl sy haar huiswerk doen.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: Ek kan niks sien as ek nie ’n bril dra nie.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: Ek verstaan niks as die musiek so hard is nie.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: Ek ruik niks as ek ’n loopneus het nie.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Ons sal ’n taxi neem as dit reën.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Ons gaan om die wêreld reis as ons die lotto wen.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Ons gaan begin eet as hy nie binnekort kom nie.

text: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
translate: Ek staan op sodra die wekker lui.

text: I become tired as soon as I have to study.
translate: Ek word moeg sodra ek moet leer.

text: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: Ek gaan ophou werk sodra ek 60 is.

text: Have you already been to Berlin?
translate: Was u al vantevore in Berlyn?

text: As soon as I have a moment.
He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
translate: Hy sal bel sodra hy tyd het.

text: I’ll work as long as I can.
translate: Ek sal werk so lank as wat ek kan.

text: I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: Ek sal werk so lank as wat ek gesond is.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: Hy lê in die bed in plaas daarvan dat hy werk.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: Sy lees die koerant in plaas daarvan dat sy kook.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: Hy sit in die kroeg in plaas daarvan dat hy huis toe gaan.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
translate: Sover ek weet, woon hy hier.

text: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Sover ek weet, is sy vrou siek.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
translate: Sover ek weet, is hy werkloos.

text: He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: Hy het aan die slaap geraak, al was die tv nog aan.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
translate: Hy het nog gebly, al was dit al laat.

text: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
translate: Hy het nie gekom nie, al het ons ’n afspraak gehad.

text: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: Die tv was aan. Ten spyte daarvan het hy aan die slaap geraak.

text: No, I don’t know anyone here.
translate: Nee, ek ken niemand hier nie.

text: a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
translate: Gaan u nog lank hier bly?

text: No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: Nee, ek gaan nie veel langer hier bly nie.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.
translate: Nee, ek wil niks meer hê nie.

text: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Ek het verslaap, andersins sou ek betyds gewees het.

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Ek het die bus verpas, andersins sou ek betyds gewees het.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Ek het die pad nie gevind nie, andersins sou ek betyds gewees het.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: Hy was reeds laat. Tog het hy nog gebly.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: Ons het ’n afspraak gehad. Tog het hy nie gekom nie.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
translate: Al het hy nie ’n rybewys nie, bestuur hy die motor.

text: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: Al is die straat glad, ry hy vinnig.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
translate: Al is hy dronk, ry hy fiets.

text: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: Hy het geen rybewys nie. Ten spyte daarvan bestuur hy die motor.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: Die straat is glad. Ten spyte daarvan ry hy vinnig.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: Hy is dronk. Ten spyte daarvan ry hy fiets.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: Sy vind nie werk nie, al het sy gestudeer.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Sy gaan nie na ’n dokter toe nie, al het sy pyn.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
translate: Sy koop ’n motor, al het sy nie geld nie.

text: No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
translate: Nee, ek het nog niks geëet nie.

text: Does anyone else want a coffee?
She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: Sy het gestudeer. Ten spyte daarvan vind sy geen werk nie.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Sy het pyn. Ten spyte daarvan gaan sy nie na die dokter toe nie.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: Sy het geen geld nie. Ten spyte daarvan koop sy ’n motor.
Dit is my kollega se jas.
Dit is my kollega se motor.
Dit is my kollega se werk.

text: The button from the shirt is gone.
translate: Die hemp se knoop is af.
Die motorhuis se sleutel is weg.

text: The boss’ computer is not working.
translate: Die baas se rekenaar is stukkend.
Wie is die meisie se ouers?

text: How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: Hoe kom ek by haar ouers se huis?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
translate: Die huis staan aan die einde van die straat.

text: What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
translate: Wat is die naam van die hoofstad van Switserland?

text: What is the title of the book?
translate: Wat is die titel van die boek?

text: What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
translate: Wat is die bure se kinders se name?
Wanneer is die kinders se skoolvakansie?

text: What are the doctor’s consultation times?
translate: Wanneer is die dokter se spreekure?

text: What time is the museum open?
translate: Wat is die openingstye van die museum?
